website_summaries.verdict: Not the fanciest polarized lenses, but they feature a nice quality metal frame and do the job.
pros: Soft rubber legs have decent coating to protect ophthalmic lenses and keep from shifting and scratching
Fit both metal and plastic frames
Great for those that use corrective lenses but not transition lenses
They cover most large style glasses
cons: If you are using navigation on your phone while wearing these, you might have trouble seeing your phone navigation because they are very dark

customer_reviews.title: Yes, they are darker than some
customer_reviews.text: Some commenters said they were too dark. That is why I ordered them. These are darker than some clip ons I have used. They are polarized, which requires you to lift them up to read an LCD screen. Some said they weren't sturdy enough. For the price, they are sturdy enough. For those of us that use corrective lenses, and don't want to wait for transition lenses to change, these are perfect especially in bright sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Don't quite fit
customer_reviews.text: The sunglass lenses are the same size as the lenses in my glasses. I measured everything before ordering. I just laid them over my glasses in one of the pictures to show that. My glasses have a support bar across the top which interferes with the clip on bar so the sunglasses won't completely cover my eyeglasses. 2 pictures show the fit with the sunglasses clipped on. I have an older pair of clip-ons with the exact same mechanism except the sunglass lenses sit lower and so completely cover the eyeglass lenses. The pictures aren't in any order but hopefully you can see the issue.
customer_reviews.author: scfan

customer_reviews.title: QC people need to read my review and act on it accordingly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these clip on shades due to light really hurting my eyes as I undergo Cancer Treatments. However, the units came with out the usual rubber tips on the metal legs that hold it on the frame and ended up scratching the lens and cost me over $120 to get new lenses that were less than a month old. I thought that the company would reach out to me but they didn't despite speaking to Amazon Prime personnel. Hopefully this review will spur them to reach out to me so that they can work closer to make sure this doesn't happen again to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Wil Engle

customer_reviews.title: Never thought I'd use these but I am!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I am using them but I am. I have been wearing my glasses more lately, and have prescription sunglasses, but man, is it a pain to switch between glasses. These are great for my short drive to work, I flip them up to read my phone if needed...which is hard to do with prescription sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: ibJ9

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: My prescription glasses are aviator style. I have been searching for clip on flip up Sun shades a long time and am pleased to report this product provides the coverage I was looking for. Form, fit, function and quality are perfect. If I ever need to replace this, I will buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Lamplighter

customer_reviews.title: Good clip-ons, but read my sizing advice, below:
customer_reviews.text: Lens size information is accurate. HOWEVER, you need to take the clip frame into account, which will raise the lenses about 6 mm above the top of your glasses. I didn't do that, and had to return them. Also, if your lenses are thick, the clip legs may be too short. That said, these are nice clip-ons. I wish they fit my "oversized" lenses. Also well packaged to prevent scratching in transit.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Martinek

customer_reviews.title: Shape does't fit my glasses
customer_reviews.text: Most flip up sun glasses are narrower than my glasses so sun leaks in around the side of my face.Not a problem with these. These are too wide across my nose so they let sun light in around my nose The description is glass lenses, The lenses are plastic. At this price no way could the lenses be glass. The lens are easy to put on and take off one handed which is good when I'm driving. Seldom are the lenses perfectly centered on my glasses but they are wide enough this isn't a problem. I have not uses the yellow lens, which are best on cloudy days in the winter in MN
customer_reviews.author: Blueeyesmn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: They didn't look as goofy as I thought they would! They cover my large wayfairer style glasses just barely. They are DARRRRK! But I like it. They function like you'd think they would, flip them up and you look like a grandma, but who cares, it's pretty nice to be able to go from dark to light without having to switch glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly Von Idershmolzen

customer_reviews.title: Do the job...however...
customer_reviews.text: Nice clip-ons, they do the job, however, the little rubber pieces that fit over the actual clip prongs fall off quite easily resulting in a scratched lens on my glasses. I didn't notice the cover was gone until it was too late....ALSO, additional covers are not available , at least not on Amazon. Next pair, I will pull off the little rubber nibs/covers and put glue inside then put them back on the prongs so they won't come off, otherwise, these clip-ons are light weight and are perfect for keeping sun/snow glare at a very minimal level. The dark color is quite soothing to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good with a couple drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: It does move a little since the springs don't hold it super tight to my glasses. The lens quality and color are great - not too dark. I tend to notice the black clip part in the top center of my view when I have them on. That takes a little getting used to. But overall they are a good inexpensive option to buying prescription sunglasses. They can never be as good as prescription sunglasses, but for what they are designed to do you probably can't do much better.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: Decent fit, Great price. What I was looking for.  A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Need these for the few bright sunny days up north in the Minnesota winter. Reached that age where I have to wear prescription glasses, These make a easy affordable solution to those really bright days, flip up feature works good. I wear these over aviation style glasses. I will buying a spare set for the glove box of each vehicle. Thank you. A+++++
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: When I got these I had cataracts and needed some help seeing clearly in the daytime. These were a convenient solution, albeit a temporary one. Easy to attach, easy to flip. They filtered the noon sun nicely and allowed me to drive longer than I probably should have. Now, the cataracts are gone and I use these as my casual sunglasses on top of the bifocals. They do a great job, and have proven quite durable over the last year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Leaves the others in the Shade!!
customer_reviews.text: The best I have found. I'v bought the Target clip-ons, the CVS clip-ons and a few pair from the odd Quick Trip but these are by far the best I have ever owned. Strong quality lens material is apparent right off. The shading suites me perfectly and the grip part is no nonsense metal with good Silicon ends to protect your glasses. And, they are at a very good price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Rubber-holders fell off after 2 days of use
customer_reviews.text: I am a trucker in the oilfields of Colorado and I wanted something I could attach to my glasses and I thought these would be good and for the first 2 days they were amazing but then the rubber pieces that hold this attachment to the glasses fell off one by one and I never found them in my truck. Now I have no form of attaching the shades to my glasses. Not a good quality
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Favela

customer_reviews.title: Love-Um
customer_reviews.text: I find these glasses to be highly useful as I drive in different places in our County. I drive in shade and sun, constantly changing. I find it challenging using standard sunglasses. constantly moving them up and down my nose for changing light conditions. These don't scratch easily (I have dropped them MANY times) and stay put on my prescription glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Farkel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic alternative to prescription sunglasses!
customer_reviews.text: Clips on easily to my prescription eye glasses. I need progressive lenses so each pair always costs me at least $500... even on Warby Parker. I'll never buy prescription sunglasses again! These flip up and down as needed so easily! You just need to make sure your eyeglass frames aren't too thick or they may not work.
customer_reviews.author: reine125

customer_reviews.title: These really are lifesavers in the true sense of the word!
customer_reviews.text: Just what the Doctor ordered, (figure of speech) This really did the trick because this time of the year (Fall) I'm always driving into the sun as I'm going to work, it is very dangerous, I survived an really bad wreck a couple of years ago, and I finally broke down and bought me a pair of clip-ons. These are perfect and have come in handy already.
customer_reviews.author: jgali38

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: I happened to buy three or four clip-ons before. They were not particularly bad or uncomfortable, but sometimes they annoyed me when I, say, turned my head a little bit too briskly, and they moved on my glasses. Not these ones: they sit perfectly firmly. Besides, I like their shape very much...
customer_reviews.author: Maximych

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit to my glasses
customer_reviews.text: I have larger framed glasses. I got these thinking that these would cover them nicely. They did not. The little rubber protectors fell off the second I touched them, and they don't want to stay on my frames. Poor design in my opinion. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotanator

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these. They are very flimsy and the clip part hits your face right between the eyes. I couldn't use them on my thicker framed glasses because they kept popping off. On my thinner frames they kept sliding. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Creamer

customer_reviews.title: Dorky but Necessary
customer_reviews.text: I love these glasses! I use them nearly every day and/or night, and they aren't broken yet! They fit very well over my prescription glasses. If you're looking for a pair of sunglasses that go over your glasses, you won't regret this one. It has a great bang-for-your-buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper James

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: They're indispensable on bright, summer days when driving. Easy to put in your shirt pocket, each to attach to your regular glasses, very effective in reducing road glare, or wherever you go in bright, summer sun.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Forrest

customer_reviews.title: It is not holding up well
customer_reviews.text: I like it except that I have had it a few days and one of the rubber/plastic lens protectors on the clip is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, High Quality Clip on Flip up Sun Glasses
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made. I totally reduce glare when I'm driving or walking. I started looking for these when stores in our area stopped carrying this type of polarized Clip-On Flip-Up. The lenses are thicker than the ones I used to buy at Walgreens, and the quality of the hinge and flip up mechanism is smooth operating and feels durable. One of the reasons I got these "retro" was because I wanted the sun glass to be bigger than my glasses... as this makes it easier to flip the up and down.
customer_reviews.author: mike o

customer_reviews.title: I like these so much more than the last clip-on's that ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these so much more than the last clip-on's that I had, and those were much more expensive. The unit is sturdy and easy to position. It came with a nice polishing cloth and a nice little bag to carry them in. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Errol

customer_reviews.title: Good for Truck Drivers That have to drive toward the sun.
customer_reviews.text: These clip on sunglasses are a little darker than the clip on sunglasses that you see at big box stores. The visual clarity seems very good. They are also very lightweight so you can use them all day if needed. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bookreader G

customer_reviews.title: Costyle Clip On Flip Up Polarized Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I use these sunglasses when I walk my dog in the late afternoon and the blinding sun is shining from the west. These sunglasses completely cover my tri-focal lenses; the clip grips the lenses firmly out of the line-of-sight and are light enough so that the added weight doesn't cause them to slide down my nose (or leave red nose piece marks on the bridgeof my nose!) The Costyle C-O-F-U-P Sunglasses are a solid 5 star rating. John Whipple, Madison, WI
customer_reviews.author: J. Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I got these because they're darker than any pair I had, though not as dark as I wanted. The pads meant to keep them from scratching my glasses fell off immediately, but I just superglued them back on and forgot about it. Unfortunately, this solution only lasted me a few months before they fell off again while I was on a walk, and lost them. I'm looking for something to replace the pads so I can use them again without scratching my glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to wear over his new glasses. We bought large thinking it would cover the full lens. It doesn't. They work but not the way we hoped they would. I would recommend measuring your glasses to make sure they fit.
customer_reviews.author: RFK

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good value. "Aviator" style lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality clip ons. Worth noting that these are "aviator" shaped clip ons - so if you're looking for ones with different lens shapes, look elsewhere. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: Like-um
customer_reviews.text: I already had some clip-on flip-ups before I got these to have a spare. I'm in and out a lot and they work so well for me I don't want to be caught without them. If an and I do lose them I intend to buy some more.
customer_reviews.author: Squeak

customer_reviews.title: reasonable price for the quality
customer_reviews.text: I hoped they would fit my frame, and they clamped perfectly on my crossbar on my frame and covered my lenses. If you have the correct frame configuration, they will be the answer to prescription sunglasses that you can flip up or down. If not, go to a specialty sunglasses shop.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Lopper

customer_reviews.title: Better off sheilding your eyes with your hand.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use when I was outdoors at work. These are too dark and at the same time lets all the light shine in from above. It kind of defeats the purpose all together. I was squinting as if I wasn't even wearing sunglasses. I stopped using them because I couldn't see clearly as it was too dark/light shining in my eyes and the portion of the clip near the nose was visible to me as I was wearing them. I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Good Flip Ups
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, very strong. Took a long time before they scratched, bent, warped, or broke. They could really take a beating. Very strong, low profile, great look.
customer_reviews.author: DeOnte Means

customer_reviews.title: Great find!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think these were dark enough. Until I went to McDonalds and couldn't even see the menu!!! I couldn't see it at all!! I had to take them off to see it. They are doing a great job of keeping me from getting nasty migraines from to much bright sunlight!! I don't go out the door without them! I love them!!! :D
customer_reviews.author: Lindas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Really cheaply made. there is no "metal frame" as advertised. In fact, they have NO frame. They do not fit my standard sized glasses well, and about the only positive thing I can say is that the clip (once you figure out exactly how to use it) really doesn't scratch your eyeglass lenses, since it's soft plastic. It is convenient that they flip up, but I don't expect them to last very long. There is nothing sturdy about these clip ons, and I wish I spent more to get a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaNYC

customer_reviews.title: Great shades
customer_reviews.text: I tried less expensive clip on shades but they didn't stand up to wear and handling. This pair is great in that it is tougher and also darker.
customer_reviews.author: BABCOMBOB

customer_reviews.title: Fit and work well over prescription glasses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to fit over my long-distance prescription glasses. I didn't want to spend another $200-$300 for a pair of prescription sunglasses, and these clip-ons work very well.
customer_reviews.author: JD Reviews

customer_reviews.title: good enough, but they don't quite fit my glasses
customer_reviews.text: This is the problem shopping online. The specs were fine, but the fit wasn't good, something you would test in a shop if you could hold this in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost clip-ons
customer_reviews.text: Good low cost clip-ons. As much a part of my car as the windshield wipers. Be aware that, like ALL polarized glasses, you may have trouble with all or part of your instrument panel. Not usually a problem. These are quite dark on their own, so you'll need to flip them up if to read some of the panel, when necessary. All that means is that they are doing their job!
customer_reviews.author: Balboos HaGadol

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit
customer_reviews.text: I had to send these back because they would not fit low enough to cover all of my lenses - had about a 1/4 to 3/8" area along the bottom of my lenses that the sunglasses did not cover.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I rated these 5 stars because they fit perfect on my glasses. They shade the sun perfect and will help prevent me from getting cataracts. The flip-ups come in handy when going from outdoors to indoors! I couldn't have asked for a better style of sunglasses. They were sent in at a fast timely speed. Thank you so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Use em for riding on motorcycle. Never fly off. Keeps bugs off normal glasses. When you walk into a room just flip up easy
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the clipon
customer_reviews.text: These clipon sunglasses are very well made. The clip mechanism works Lenses are good quality. The price is outstanding for this quality. Clipon are still clipons.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: This was awesome for my eyeglasses
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loved my sunglass clip-on it’s stylish and does it job. It’s very cheap compared to those eyeglasses that transition and then it’s not even in style. It makes me look dorky. There’s nicer once but more expensive. This definitely does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Asian Freckles

customer_reviews.title: Fits well. Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit over my glasses. Looks like I'm wearing sunshades. No problem attaching to glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Bailey-Rice

customer_reviews.title: Obscure Vision
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived MUCH later that I was told it would (arrived July 6th, was told it would arrive June 29th). The plastic piece in the middle obscures your vision so I actually ended up returning it. The quality was fine, shape was good, etc. I was just really disappointed at the delivery time because they arrived AFTER the event I wanted to use them for, rendering them useless.
customer_reviews.author: Discount On Me

customer_reviews.title: Costyle Black Grey Retro Polarized Clip on Flip up Plastic Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Was hoping glasses were bigger, as they appear to be in the pictures. But they’ll work fine.
customer_reviews.author: AR15

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These were great, attached easily to my glasses and were lightweight and comfortable for long drives
customer_reviews.author: Corleys

customer_reviews.title: They seem to make my vision clearer, maybe its ...
customer_reviews.text: They seem to make my vision clearer, maybe its the polarizing. I was able to trim them with scissors so the fit my glasses perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: These are aviator sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: The black/gray sunglasses really keep the glare of the sun out of your eyes. With these clip ons you will want to wear a hat with a wide rim to protect your eyes from the sunlight from the sun filtering down from the top of your prescription glasses.
customer_reviews.author: snowflake

customer_reviews.title: ... be raised up a tad so thats not as bad. i like that it covers my whole glasses
customer_reviews.text: not as dark as i had hoped for and they push down on my nose and cheeks because there so big but they can be raised up a tad so thats not as bad.i like that it covers my whole glasses.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Hubster loves them...though they do sometimes make him act weird.
customer_reviews.text: My husband recently upgraded his glasses prescription and wanted to turn his older, yet still functional, glasses into driving sunglasses. I looked into getting the treatment over the lenses, but it was way more expensive than we'd hoped. So...we got these instead. They aren't too small or too big, and are a quality product. Aside from the fact that my husband always feels compelled to talk and act like he's a sleazy used-car salesman when he wears them (not sure WHY he associates these with that kind of person), he's really happy with them. He keeps them in his car and uses them with both pairs of glasses. He loves that he can do that. So, a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KnexTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Decent in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Lenses are flimsy, and looking at any kind of computer, phone, or technological screen, looks funky. The clip is good and matches up great with my glasses. The clip is very noticable though.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I tried these.
customer_reviews.text: So 80's but I don't care. I like not having to have two pair of glasses with me while outside. I even bought a second pair, one for work, and one for the car. The flip up feature works great. They clip on and unclip very easily. (I wear wire frame glasses.) The shades cover the frame so you can't notice that the shape is different. They are also dark, which works well for me. I live in Florida and it is very bright here most of the year.
customer_reviews.author: K-DIY

customer_reviews.title: Clips don't fit on glasses
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for one set of glasses. They didn't clip on at all because the glasses have a small bar across the tops of the lenses. Tried the flip ups on two other pairs of glasses. They barely managed to clip on to either, although other clip-on brands have worked fine with those glasses in the past. Perhaps the clips on these flip ups are too short or too narrow for good clipping. Maybe someday we'll find glasses where they actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: A kool good deal
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to find clip on sunglasses in local store. Amazon was the best choice. I love these so much, I purchased two.
customer_reviews.author: Allan R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: lost protective plastic sleves quickly
customer_reviews.text: fit OK and worked OK but I changed frames and couldn't use them anymore
customer_reviews.author: gary france

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality. I use for a few weeks then the rubber part start fall off then I will scratch you glasses. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Yu

customer_reviews.title: Work Nice
customer_reviews.text: These are quite light weight and decently made especially for the price, I like them
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: these are amazing for my 96 year old mother
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sunglasses, mom is 96 in Massachusetts I'm in Virginia, I looked at the most recent pic my daughter took while visiting her bought these and my mom loves them she said they are perfect fit, lightweight east to clip on and she has trouble doin things like small clips being 96........AAAAAAA++++++++++++ we are giving great product fast delivery, cheap shipping. Thank you!!!!!!!😇😇😇😇😇😇
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice clip-ons, especially at the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice clip-ons, especially at the price. The rubberized clips fit both my (smaller) glasses and my husband's (larger) glasses well. Easy to put on and remove. The polarized lenses are dark and fit well against our eyeglass lenses. We use them in the car and are very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I keep them in the car
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I keep them in the car, where they take up hardly any space and are protected in the pouch that comes with them. I can clip them on or off with ease, or flip them up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Lundell

customer_reviews.title: Was the Quality Control guy  mia
customer_reviews.text: "Amazon.com has new recommendations for you based on items you purchased or told us you own." That is the lead of an email from Amazon offering me the opportunity to purchase flip up sun glasses presumably to replace the pair they sold me about two weeks earlier. Did they suspect that the Flip up AVIATOR Plastic Sunglas I purchased had already fallen apart? Such prescience (foreknowledge) on their part is Amazing. The weld attaching the flip part had clearly failed. Too much trouble to return. Of the 35 items I have purchased in the last six months, all the others were super dooper.
customer_reviews.author: J.L. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everything except looking cool
customer_reviews.text: these make me look absolutely ridiculous and i dont care at all. I flip them up and stare at people who question me. Sorry you feel its cooler to wear a SECOND pair of glasses as a head band and then switch out. I'm ust gonna flip these up. Oh whats that I can use them as a viser too?!? OKAY THEN. Perfect for everything except looking cool.
customer_reviews.author: Gooj

customer_reviews.title: Accentuates my sweet smile
customer_reviews.text: Wow so fantastic! Helps me see when driving or when I go outside. So stylish and does a fantastic job looking straight COOL when flipped up.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Rolfe

customer_reviews.title: COULD BE DARKER
customer_reviews.text: The quality is plastic and not the best. However, for the price, it is OK. Blocks sun out very good even when driving directly into it. It could be darker since my glasses frame can still be seen when I wear it. Not a bad purchase for the low price. Price is nearly doubled at local stores for a similar product.
customer_reviews.author: RODGERDODGER

customer_reviews.title: too hard to put on and off
customer_reviews.text: worked for a while, but hard to get onto glasses and once they popped the lens out of my Rx glasses.. don't use them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they were good quality, just too small for my glasses
customer_reviews.text: I returned them, they were good quality, just too small for my glasses. Not wide enough and they looked kind of goofy with my eyeglasses showing on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: SpikeO

customer_reviews.title: Too Dark
customer_reviews.text: They work okay. But they're a bit too dark. In all but the brightest sun, they cut one's vision far too much.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Engelbach

customer_reviews.title: Best I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Good fit on my style glasses work well to take out sun glare when driving
customer_reviews.author: Athabasco

customer_reviews.title: The rubber pieces fall off
customer_reviews.text: I should have sent them back soon as I got them . The rubber pieces fell off scratch my glasses
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Decent product but excellent customer serice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a year ago. They are great to have in the car as an accessory for when things get too sunny while drive. It's merely a safety precaution I use them for. I contacted the seller on a particular question and they were very quick to get back to me and work out a resolution. That is always appreciated! Product: 4/5 due to the nose pieces getting loose Customer Service: 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Work with my Warby Parkers
customer_reviews.text: After quickly breaking a $70 pair specifically made for my glasses, I gave these a try and won't look back. Fit fine and have great polarization. For the price I don't worry about breakage, but they're sturdy and I haven't broken them yet.
customer_reviews.author: EFG

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: They clip on and stay on. I haven't had any issues with them getting scratched up or them breaking, on top of that they are so cheap that if they do break I'll buy another pair. The lenses are flexible and they haven't cracked while in my back pocket. My only complaint, and it's minor for me, is that the clip is slightly visible when wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Buying something for less than $10 you always should keep your expectations in check but this one looks good and feels good. It's not flimsy and putting it is as easy as it gets. It might be too dark for some but sunglasses is always preferrential but my dad loves it so recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Edinbruh

customer_reviews.title: They do a good job blocking out a lot of light
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY dark. They also limit my peripheral vision for some reason. After two close calls while driving I only use these for non-motorized purposes. They do a good job blocking out a lot of light, but be careful - in some instances they block out too much light.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Eddie

customer_reviews.title: These are nice shades but i don't care for the fact that ...
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shades but i don't care for the fact that the little clips are in my field of view where they sit....on the bridge of my glasses. Otherwise, very nice but I will gift them because i don't like how the clips sit on my glasses.
customer_reviews.author: KNairn

customer_reviews.title: Dark - Dark Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I find these sun glasses way too dark for me, you can look right into the sun with these things although NOT recommended - please. But, frequently I have to flip them up to see cars because they are so DARK. I will keep them as spares and order another pair that are not as dark. The mechanism works fine for the two months that I have used them.
customer_reviews.author: G. McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Save money!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of purchasing prescribed sunglasses every year. I love this. Keep it in my car and only use it for driving.
customer_reviews.author: Maria R.

customer_reviews.title: So awesome
customer_reviews.text: I felt like Duane from It's a different world. Lol. Love this product...glasses wearers can enjoy the luxury of shades without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The Best in the market ... I tried many clip on products This is the best and very comfy So I bought it twice actually
customer_reviews.author: Sherif Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good polarizing lenses, no glare, scratch resistant. Cons: Clip falls apart into the two main pieces often, should have been made as one solid piece.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: good!
customer_reviews.text: I only wear it when driving. Not very attractive looking tho!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for driving
customer_reviews.text: Love these glasses! I get such bad headaches when I drive in direct sunlight sometimes, and using glasses, it's hard to find sunglasses that fit over them. These clip-ons are great and are the solution to all my problems!
customer_reviews.author: ally

customer_reviews.title: I could not transition from light to much less light so easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have retinitis pigmentosa. These glasses have shielded my eyes from the sun , and when I get inside a building I flip them up and I see very clearly. Without the flips, I could not transition from light to much less light so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: While the lens is the same size as my glasses, when clipped to the eyebrow bar of my glasses it rides too high. Thus the top of this clip on is abouve my glasses and the bottom is above to bottom of my glasses. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: mykecusa

customer_reviews.title: necessary stuff for driving trip
customer_reviews.text: you need it for driving high way, it is perfect. The glass is a little big, it will touch my face sometimes
customer_reviews.author: harold

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit darker than other sunglasses and larger in size but that is a good thing during hot bright sunny days when you need ample protection. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: V. Rangarajan

customer_reviews.title: The clip on sunglasses are exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I just had cataract surgery and needed to have the right lens of my glasses taken out. I went to several stores to get clip on sun glasses with no luck. The clip on sun glasses I received cover my glasses and protect my right eye from the sun during my healing and before I get a new prescription for my new glasses. I know this might sound a little strange, but it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L. De Martini

customer_reviews.title: Minimal polarization.
customer_reviews.text: Yes they are polarized but it is slight. Nothing like previous one I have had. At $9 I probably won't return but cannot recommend
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!!
customer_reviews.text: These clip-on sunglasses are the best out of all the ones I have tried, and I've tried a lot.There are easy to put on your glasses and they are not to dark and takes out the glare. I recommend these Clip-On 100%
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Love the shades
customer_reviews.text: Favorite shades ever! Fit extremely well with my glasses and they do make everything darker which exactly what I wanted. It's cheap enough I ordered me a second pair to keep extra in case I break them or lose them
customer_reviews.author: manuel

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Little bit small than I have glass But works great
customer_reviews.author: Jacob.D.LEE

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: These sunglasses were perfect. They're dark enough, they fit my frames well, and they even come with a drawstring bag and a cleaning cloth. I like them so much, I just ordered a second pair!
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Burk

customer_reviews.title: did not like. maybe useful for watching an outdoor event but ...
customer_reviews.text: did not like. maybe useful for watching an outdoor event but were not useful for driving
customer_reviews.author: KIM

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it, really poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it, really poor quality! It broke down after a few days. If I could rate 0 stars, I definitely would never rate 1 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JJ.noble

customer_reviews.title: I love these shades!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and makes everthing outside look crystal clear! I love them and am very satisfied! So satisfied I bought another pair!
customer_reviews.author: hobie67

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality. Extremely clear and works very well for driving at sunlight
customer_reviews.author: Duoyi

customer_reviews.title: They fit my glasses perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I liked they fit so well. The only thing that gets a bit of a concern is taking them on and off, it gets a little tenuous since I don't want to scratch them. The are stylish and protecting my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cheryl

product_meta.title: Costyle Black Grey Retro Polarized Clip on Flip up Plastic Sunglasses Driving Fishing Traveling
feature_bullets: Soft rubber Legs have proprietary coating to protect ophthalmic lenses and prevent shifting and scratching
New design leg profile to fit both metal and plastic frames
Convenient one hand application to Prescription frames with positive indexing lens positions
